diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of atypical Reiterâ€™s syndrome was made based on the constellation of clinical features including painful genital ulcerations, conjunctivitis, low back pain, stomatitis, and psoriasiform skin lesions, supported by positive serology for Chlamydia trachomatis. Key histologic findings included focal psoriasiform hyperplasia and spongiform pustules, differentiating it from other differential diagnoses while no definitive histological diagnosis like psoriasis or pemphigus vegetans was established.
